service.description: A service that allows subscribers to record notices or information to a dedicated notice board number using a Nepal Telecom phone. Callers to that number will hear the recorded message. The subscriber can edit or delete the recording as needed.
key_features: No new equipment needed at customer's premises
Available to anyone with or without a landline
Notice board owners can record, edit, and delete their own messages
Messages are password protected for security
Message duration can be from 1 to 3 minutes
target_users: Schools/Colleges for general and emergency notices
Business organizations for product information and ads
Airline offices for flight information and updates
Traffic Police Office for traffic updates
Money exchange centers and banks for forex rates
FM radios/TV stations for program schedules
Hospitals and polyclinics for their services

application_process.step_1: Subscriber must fill out a form and FAX it to 01-4227777 or email the request letter with necessary documents.
application_process.step_2: A copy of PAN and office registration letter must be attached to the form.

recording_a_message.description: To record an audio notice on the notice board using Nepal Telecom's GSM or Fixed Phones.
steps: Dial 1610 - Area Code - Telephone Number subscribed for Audio Notice Board Service. Example: 1610-01-4241XXX
Follow the IVR (Interactive Voice Response) instructions.

listening_to_messages.description: To listen to the recorded notice.
steps: Dial the notice board number provided by Nepal Telecom.
Dialing pattern: 1618 - area code - telephone number. Example: 1618-01-4241XXX
The access code 1618 can be dialed from all NT networks (PSTN, GSM, VSAT, and Payphones) throughout the country.

technical_support.office: Nepal Telecom, Provincial Directorate Kathmandu, Bagmati Pradesh, Switching Division Sundhara, Kathmandu
